 22class TextModelBackend(GenAIBaseBackend):
 23    """ Backend for OpenAI models
 24
 25    Enables creating an OpenAI model via a connection string, e.g.
 26    om.models.put('openai://<base_url>;model=<model>', 'mymodel'). The connection
 27    string must be in the format openai://<base_url>;model=<model> where <base_url>
 28    is the base URL of the OpenAI-compatible model server's REST API, and <model>
 29    is the model name as known to the model server. The connection string may also
 30    include an apikey, e.g. 'openai://<apikey>@<base_url>;model=<model>'.
 31
 32    Usage:
 33        # create a model
 34        om.models.put('openai://localhost:8000/mymodel', 'mymodel')
 35        # get the model
 36        model = om.models.get('mymodel')
 37        # use the model
 38        result = model.complete('hello, how are you?')
 39
 40    Notes:
 41        * the actual implementation of the model handling logic is in OpenAIModel,
 42          this only provides the model store interface and acts as any VirtualObjectHandler
 43    """
 44    KIND = 'genai.text'
 45    STORED_MODEL_URL = 'omegaml://models'
 46


[docs]
 47    @classmethod
 48    def supports(cls, obj, name, **kwargs):
 49        return isinstance(obj, str) and (re.match(r'openai(\+.*)?://', obj) or obj.startswith(cls.STORED_MODEL_URL))


 50
 51    def _parse_url(self, obj):
 52        # properly parse RFC 1808 URLs
 53        # -- format: <vendor>+<protocol>://<base_url>;<params>?<query>
 54        # -- https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1808#section-2.1
 55        # Python urlparse does not support ;params parsing in custom schemes
 56        # -- depending on the path, ;params ends up in path, netloc or hostname
 57        # -- we fix that by adjusting the parsed result
 58        # -- .vendor is the vendor, e.g. openai
 59        # -- .scheme is the protocol, e.g. https
 60        uri, params = obj.split(';', 1) if ';' in obj else (obj, '')
 61        parsed = urlsplit(uri)
 62        vendor, scheme = parsed.scheme.split('+') if '+' in parsed.scheme else ('', parsed.scheme)
 63        path, params = parsed.path.split(';', 1) if ';' in parsed.path else (parsed.path, params)
 64        netloc, params = parsed.netloc.split(';', 1) if ';' in parsed.netloc else (parsed.netloc, params)
 65        hostname, params = parsed.hostname.split(';', 1) if ';' in parsed.hostname else (parsed.hostname, params)
 66        port = parsed.port or (443 if scheme == 'https' else 80)
 67        ParseResult = namedtuple('ParseResult', ['vendor', 'scheme',
 68                                                 'path', 'params', 'netloc', 'hostname', 'port', 'username', 'password',
 69                                                 'query'])
 70        return ParseResult(vendor, scheme, path, params, netloc, hostname, port, parsed.username,
 71                           parsed.password, parsed.query)
 72


[docs]
 73    def put(self, obj, name, template=None, prompt=None, pipeline=None, provider=None, tools=None, documents=None,
 74            strategy=None, apikey=None, **kwargs):
 75        self.model_store: OmegaStore
 76        parsed = self._parse_url(obj)
 77        params = parse_qs(parsed.params)
 78        if 'model' in params:
 79            model = params.pop('model')[0]
 80            path = parsed.path
 81        else:
 82            path, model = parsed.path.split('/', 1) if '/' in parsed.path else (parsed.path, None)
 83        assert model, f'no model specified in {obj}, use openai://<base_url>;model=<model> or openai+<scheme>://<base_url>;model=<model>'
 84        base_url = f'{parsed.scheme}://{parsed.hostname}:{parsed.port}{path}'
 85        uri_creds = f'{parsed.username}:{parsed.password}' if parsed.username and parsed.password else ''
 86        uri_creds = uri_creds or f'{parsed.username}' if parsed.username else ''
 87        creds = apikey or uri_creds
 88        query = parse_qs(parsed.query)
 89        params = params or {}
 90        query = query or {}
 91        provider = provider or self._infer_provider(base_url)
 92        kind_meta = {
 93            'base_url': base_url,
 94            'creds': creds,
 95            'model': model,
 96            'query': query,
 97            'params': params,
 98            'provider': provider,
 99        }
100        attributes = {
101            'prompt': prompt or query.get('prompt'),
102            'template': template or query.get('template'),
103            'pipeline': pipeline or None,
104            'tools': tools or [],
105            'documents': documents or [],
106            'strategy': strategy or {},
107        }
108        kwargs.update(attributes=attributes)
109        meta = self.model_store.make_metadata(name,
110                                              kind=self.KIND,
111                                              kind_meta=kind_meta,
112                                              **kwargs)
113        return meta.save()


114


[docs]
115    def get(self, name, prompt=None, template=None, data_store=None, pipeline=None, tools=None, documents=None,
116            strategy=None,
117            tracking=None, secrets=None, **kwargs):
118        meta = self.model_store.metadata(name)
119        secrets = secrets or {}
120        # setup from connection string
121        kind_meta = meta.kind_meta
122        base_url = kind_meta['base_url']
123        model = kind_meta['model']
124        query = kind_meta['query']
125        params = kind_meta['params']
126        creds = kind_meta['creds']
127        provider = kind_meta['provider']
128        params.update(kwargs)
129        # setup from attributes
130        model = meta.attributes.get('model') or model
131        pipeline = pipeline or meta.attributes.get('pipeline')
132        tools = tools or meta.attributes.get('tools') or []
133        documents = documents or meta.attributes.get('documents')
134        template = template or query.get('template') or meta.attributes.get('template')
135        prompt = prompt or query.get('prompt') or meta.attributes.get('prompt')
136        strategy = {**(meta.attributes.get('strategy') or {}), **(strategy or {})}
137        # load dependencies
138        data_store = data_store or (self.data_store if self.data_store is not self.model_store else None)
139        pipeline = self._load_pipeline(pipeline)
140        documents = self._load_documents(documents)
141        tools = self._load_tools(tools)
142        base_url = self._resolve_placeholders(base_url, secrets)
143        creds = self._resolve_placeholders(creds, secrets)
144        self.tracking = tracking or self.tracking or self._ensure_tracking(meta)
145        # infer model provider
146        if base_url.startswith(self.STORED_MODEL_URL) and self.model_store.exists(model):
147            # model is a stored model, load it
148            model = self.model_store.get(model, prompt=prompt, template=template, data_store=data_store,
149                                         pipeline=pipeline, tools=tools, documents=documents, strategy=strategy,
150                                         tracking=self.tracking, **kwargs)
151
152        else:
153            model = TextModel(base_url, model, api_key=creds, prompt=prompt, template=template,
154                              data_store=data_store, pipeline=pipeline, tools=tools,
155                              tracking=self.tracking, provider=provider, documents=documents,
156                              strategy=strategy,
157                              **params)
158        return model


159
160    def drop(self, name, data_store=None, force=False, **kwargs):
161        meta = self.model_store.metadata(name)
162        data_store = data_store or (self.data_store if self.data_store is not self.model_store else None)
163        return self.model_store._drop(name, force=force, **kwargs)
164
165    def _load_tools(self, tools):
166        tool_fns = [tool if callable(tool) else self.model_store.get(f'tools/{tool}') for tool in tools]
167        return tool_fns
168
169    def _load_documents(self, documents):
170        documents = self.data_store.get(documents, model_store=self.model_store) if isinstance(documents,
171                                                                                               str) else documents
172        return documents
173
174    def _load_pipeline(self, pipeline):
175        pipeline = pipeline if callable(pipeline) else (
176            self.model_store.get(pipeline) if isinstance(pipeline, str) else None)
177        return pipeline
178
179    def _resolve_placeholders(self, creds, secrets):
180        values = ({k: v for k, v in os.environ.items() if k.isupper() and isinstance(v, (str, bytes))}
181                  if self.model_store.defaults.OMEGA_ALLOW_ENV_CONFIG else dict())
182        values.update(**self.model_store.defaults)
183        values.update(secrets)
184        user = getattr(self.model_store.defaults, 'OMEGA_USERID', getuser())
185        return creds.format_map(KeepMissing({**values, "userid": user}))
186
187    def _infer_provider(self, url):
188        for provider, cls in PROVIDERS.items():
189            if cls.match_url(url):
190                return provider
191        return 'default'
192
193    def _ensure_tracking(self, meta):
194        # ensure we have a tracking instance for the model
195        # caveats:
196        # - this is typically a responsibility of the omega runtime, however
197        #   a conversation model without a tracking instance is useless
198        # - thus we adopt the convention that if the runtime does not provide a tracking instance,
199        #   we create one for the model
200        # TODO: verify that this is the right place to do this
201        default_name = meta.attributes.get('tracking', {}).get('default', meta.kind_meta.get('model'))
202        if self.tracking is None or isinstance(self.tracking.experiment, NoTrackTracker):
203            self.tracking = OmegaSimpleTracker(default_name, store=self.data_store)
204            self.tracking.start()
205        return self.tracking


206
207
208class TextModel(GenAIModel):
209    """ OpenAI model
210
211    This implements the OpenAI model interface. It is a thin wrapper around the OpenAI API,
212    and adds conversation tracking and data storage for the conversation history. For chat completions,
213    the conversation history is stored in a dataset named ./openai/messages/<modelname>/<user>. For
214    completions without a conversation id, a new conversation id is generated and returned in each
215    message, however the conversation history is not stored in this case. The complete() method
216    can be called with a conversation id to continue a conversation, in this case it is equivalent
217    to chat().
218
219    The model implements a callback to a user function or virtul object handler, called the pipeline.
220    The pipeline is called with the method name, the conversation id, the prompt message, and
221    the messages so far. It can be used to implement custom logic for preparing the messages and
222    the response.
223
224    Usage:
225
226        Create and access a model::
227
228            # create a model
229            om.models.put('openai://localhost:8000/mymodel', 'mymodel')
230            model = om.models.get('mymodel')
231            # complete a prompt
232            result = model.complete('hello, how are you?')
233            # chat
234            conversation_id, result = model.chat('hello, how are you?')
235            # continue a conversation
236            result = model.complete('I am fine, thank you.', conversation_id=conversation_id)
237
238        Implement a pipeline::
239
240            # add a pipeline
241            @virtual_genai
242            def my_pipeline(method, conversation_id, prompt_message, messages):
243                # implement your logic here
244                if method == 'prepare':
245                    # prepare the initial messages
246                    return messages
247                elif method == 'template':
248                    # prepare the template
249                    return 'You are a helpful assistant.'
250                elif method == 'process':
251                    # process the response
252                    return response_message
253
254            model = om.models.get('mymodel', pipeline=my_pipeline)
255            result = model.complete('hello, how are you?')
256
257            # store the pipeline in a virtual object
258            om.models.put(my_pipeline, 'my_pipeline')
259            model = om.models.put('openai://localhost:8000/mymodel', 'mymodel', pipeline='my_pipeline')
260            # this will automatically load the pipeline, and get it called for each stage
261            result = model.complete('hello, how are you?')
262
263        A pipeline can be used to implement custom logic for preparing the messages and to check
264        or change the response. The pipeline can return any messages, a custom template, or
265        a custom response.
266
267        Get back the conversation history::
268
269            model = om.models.get('mymodel')
270            messages = model.conversation(conversation_id)
271
272    .. versionchanged:: NEXT
273        the ./openai/messages dataset has been replaced by standard experiment tracking
274        (use om.datasets to access prior conversations)
275    """
276
277    def __init__(self, base_url, model, api_key=None, template=None, prompt=None, data_store=None,
278                 tracking=None, pipeline=None, provider='openai', tools=None, documents=None,
279                 strategy=None, **kwargs):
280        super().__init__()
281        self.base_url = base_url
282        self.model = model
283        self.api_key = api_key
284        self.kwargs = kwargs
285        self.template = (template or self._default_template).strip()
286        self.prompt = prompt or 'You are a helpful assistant.'
287        self.data_store = data_store
288        self.tracking = tracking
289        self.provider = PROVIDERS[provider](
290            api_key=api_key,
291            base_url=base_url,
292            model=model)
293        self.pipeline = pipeline or (lambda *args, **kwargs: None)
294        self.tools = tools
295        self.tools_specs = [self._get_function_spec(tool) for tool in tools] if tools else None
296        self.documents = documents
297        self.strategy = strategy or {
298            # kwargs to pass to DocumentIndex.retrieve()
299            'retrieve': {
300                'top': 1,
301            }
302        }
303
304    def __repr__(self):
305        return f'TextModel(base_url={self.base_url}, model={self.model})'
306
307    @property
308    def _default_template(self):
309        return """
310        {% if documents -%} 
311            documents found: {{ documents }} 
312        {%- endif %} 
313        {{ prompt }}
314        """
315
316    def load(self, method):
317        pass
318
319    def embed(self, documents, dimensions=None, raw=False, conversation_id=None, **kwargs):
320        dimensions = dimensions or self.kwargs.get('dimensions', 256)
321        response = self.provider.embed(documents, dimensions=dimensions, model=self.model,
322                                       **kwargs)
323        conversation_id = conversation_id or uuid4().hex
324        self._track_usage(response, conversation_id=conversation_id)
325        transformed = (d['embedding'] for d in response['data'])
326        return response if raw else list(transformed)
327
328    def complete(self, prompt, messages=None, conversation_id=None, raw=False, data=None,
329                 chat=False, stream=False, use_tools=True, **kwargs):
330        """ complete a prompt
331
332        Will call the provider's chat.completion endpoint. Can be called in two modes:
333        1) completion without conversation tracking (no conversation id, chat=False),
334        2) chat completion with conversation tracking (chat=True, or conversation id).
335
336        Args:
337            prompt (str):
338            messages (list[dict]):
339            conversation_id (str):
340            raw (bool):
341            data:
342            chat:
343            stream:
344            use_tools:
345            **kwargs:
346
347        Returns:
348
349        """
350
351        def parse_completion_response(r):
352            response, _, response_message, raw_response = r
353            return response_message if not raw else raw_response
354
355        def parse_chat_response(r):
356            conversation_id, response, _, response_message, raw_response = r
357            return response_message if not raw else raw_response
358
359        if not chat and conversation_id is None:
360            responses = self._do_complete(prompt, messages=messages, data=data,
361                                          stream=stream, use_tools=use_tools, raw=raw, **kwargs)
362            response_parser = parse_completion_response
363        else:
364            # chat or conversation id provided
365            responses = self._do_chat(prompt, messages=messages, conversation_id=conversation_id,
366                                      data=data,
367                                      stream=stream,
368                                      use_tools=use_tools,
369                                      raw=raw,
370                                      **kwargs)
371            response_parser = parse_chat_response
372        # return response(s)
373        response_gen = (response_parser(response) for response in responses)
374        return response_gen if stream else [response for response in response_gen][-1]
375
376    def chat(self, prompt, conversation_id=None, raw=False, stream=False, use_tools=True, **kwargs):
377        responses = self._do_chat(prompt,
378                                  conversation_id=conversation_id,
379                                  stream=stream,
380                                  use_tools=use_tools,
381                                  **kwargs)
382
383        def response_parser(r):
384            conversation_id, response, prompt_response, response_message, raw_response = r
385            return conversation_id, (response if raw else response_message)
386
387        response_gen = (response_parser(response) for response in responses)
388        return response_gen if stream else [response for response in response_gen][-1]
389
390    def _do_chat(self, prompt, messages=None, conversation_id=None, data=None, use_tools=False, raw=False,
391                 stream=False, **kwargs):
392        assert self.data_store, "chat requires a data_store, specify data_store=om.datasets"
393        assert self.tracking, "chat requires a tracking instance, use with om.runtime.experiment(): ... "
394        conversation_id = conversation_id or uuid4().hex
395        # if the client sends in messages, don't recall past conversations (they are already in messages)
396        messages = messages or self.conversation(conversation_id, raw=True)
397        system_message_missing = not any(m.get('role') == 'system' for m in messages)
398        empty = lambda d: d.empty if isinstance(d, pd.DataFrame) else not d
399        if empty(messages) or system_message_missing:
400            # no message history, insert the system message to start off the conversation)
401            messages = [self._system_message(self.prompt, conversation_id=conversation_id)] + (
402                messages if messages else [])
403            self._log_events('conversation', conversation_id, messages)
404        responses = self._do_complete(prompt, messages=messages, conversation_id=conversation_id, data=data,
405                                      use_tools=use_tools, raw=raw, stream=stream, **kwargs)
406        to_store = []
407        for response in responses:
408            response, prompt_message, response_message, raw_response = response
409            finish_reason = response_message.get('finish_reason')
410            consolidated = finish_reason == 'stop.consolidated'
411            if not stream or (stream and consolidated):
412                # only store consolidated responses
413                # -- if streaming, response_message is merged from all choices[0].delta
414                # -- if not streaming, response_message is the choices[0].message
415                # wrapping in deepcopy() to avoid modification by the data store (e.g. adding _id)
416                to_store.extend([
417                    deepcopy(prompt_message),
418                    deepcopy(response_message)
419                ])
420            if not consolidated:
421                # the stop.consolidated message is internal to TextModel, do not return it
422                yield conversation_id, response, prompt_message, response_message, raw_response
423        self._log_events('conversation', conversation_id, to_store)
424
425    def _call_tools(self, tool_calls, conversation_id):
426        # process tool calls
427        results = []
428        tool_prompts = []
429        for tool_call in tool_calls:
430            tool = [(ts, tf) for ts, tf in zip(self.tools_specs, self.tools)
431                    if tf.__name__ == tool_call['function']['name']]
432            if tool:
433                tool, tool_func = tool[0]
434                tool_kwargs = json.loads(tool_call['function']['arguments'])
435                try:
436                    tool_result = tool_func(**tool_kwargs)
437                except Exception as e:
438                    tool_result = str(e)
439                tool_response = {
440                    "role": "assistant",
441                    "content": tool_result,
442                    "conversation_id": conversation_id,
443                }
444                results.append(tool_response)
445                tool_prompts.append({
446                    "role": "tool",
447                    "tool_call_id": tool_call["id"],
448                    "content": str(tool_result)
449                })
450                self._log_events('toolcall', conversation_id, {
451                    'name': tool_call['function']['name'],
452                    'too_call_id': tool_call['id'],
453                    'arguments': tool_kwargs,
454                    'result': str(tool_result),
455                })
456        return results, tool_prompts
457
458    def conversation(self, conversation_id=None, raw=False, **filter):
459        """ Retrieve conversation messages
460
461        Args:
462            conversation_id (str): the conversation id to retrieve messages for
463            raw (bool): if True, return raw messages as dicts, otherwise return a DataFrame
464            filter (dict): additional filters to apply to the conversation messages
465
466        Returns:
467            pd.DataFrame or list[dict]: the conversation messages, either as a DataFrame or a list of dicts
468        """
469        assert self.data_store, "this model does not track conversations, specify .get(...., data_store=om.datasets)"
470        assert self.tracking, "this model does not track conversations, use with om.runtime.experiment(): ... "
471        filter.setdefault('run', '*')
472        filter.setdefault('key', conversation_id)
473        messages = self.tracking.data(event='conversation', **filter)
474        if messages is not None and 'value' in messages.columns:
475            messages = pd.concat([messages.reset_index(), pd.json_normalize(messages['value'])], axis=1)
476            # FIXME fillna('') is deprecated for numeric columns (handle in serialization?)
477            messages.fillna('', inplace=True)
478            columns = list(set(messages.columns) & {'key', 'role', 'content', 'finish_reason', 'dt'})
479            return messages[columns] if not raw else messages.to_dict('records')
480        return pd.DataFrame() if not raw else []
481
482    def _system_message(self, prompt, conversation_id=None):
483        return {
484            "role": "system",
485            "content": prompt,
486            "conversation_id": conversation_id or uuid4().hex,
487        }
488
489    def _do_complete(self, prompt, messages=None, conversation_id=None, data=None, stream=False,
490                     use_tools=False, raw=False, **kwargs):
491        conversation_id = conversation_id or uuid4().hex
492        messages = messages or []
493        kwargs.update(self.strategy.get('complete', {}))
494        # prepare template
495        _template = self._prepare_template(self.template,
496                                           data=data)
497        template = self.pipeline(method='template',
498                                 prompt_message=prompt,
499                                 messages=messages,
500                                 template=self.template,
501                                 conversation_id=conversation_id, **kwargs) or _template
502        if prompt and isinstance(prompt, str):
503            # support direct text input
504            prompt_message = {
505                "role": "user",
506                "content": prompt,
507                "conversation_id": conversation_id,
508            }
509            messages.insert(0, self._system_message(self.prompt, conversation_id=conversation_id))
510            messages += [self._augment_message(prompt_message, documents=self.documents, template=template)]
511        elif isinstance(prompt, dict):
512            # support structured input
513            # -- see OpenAI /chat/completions endpoint, "messages" parameter
514            #    https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat
515            # -- assume prompt is a fully formed provider-compatible message,e.g. from a chat client
516            messages.insert(0, self._system_message(self.prompt, conversation_id=conversation_id))
517            messages += [self._augment_message(prompt, documents=self.documents, template=template)]
518            prompt_message = messages[-1]
519        elif isinstance(prompt, list):
520            # support structured input, as messages
521            # -- see OpenAI /chat/completions endpoint, "messages" parameter
522            #    https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat
523            # -- assume prompt is a fully formed provider-compatible message,e.g. from a chat client
524            messages.insert(0, self._system_message(self.prompt, conversation_id=conversation_id))
525            # augment last message only
526            messages += prompt[:-1] if len(prompt) > 1 else []
527            messages += [self._augment_message(prompt[-1], documents=self.documents, template=template)]
528            prompt_message = messages[-1]
529        else:
530            # raw input, assume messages contains the user prompt
531            messages.insert(0, self._system_message(self.prompt, conversation_id=conversation_id))
532            # augment last message only
533            messages += [self._augment_message(messages[-1], documents=self.documents, template=template)]
534            prompt_message = messages[-1]
535        # prepare tools
536        if self.tools:
537            kwargs.update(tools=self.tools_specs,
538                          tool_choice='auto')
539        # prepare messages
540        _default_messages = messages
541        messages = self.pipeline(method='prepare',
542                                 prompt_message=prompt_message,
543                                 messages=messages,
544                                 template=template,
545                                 conversation_id=conversation_id, **kwargs) or _default_messages
546        # produce a response by calling the pipeline or the model
547        response = self.pipeline(method='complete',
548                                 prompt_message=prompt_message,
549                                 messages=messages,
550                                 template=template,
551                                 conversation_id=conversation_id, **kwargs) or self.provider.complete(
552            messages=messages,
553            stream=stream,
554            model=self.model,
555            **kwargs
556        )
557
558        def maybe_call_tools(response, prompt_message, response_message, use_tools=False, as_delta=False):
559            """ prepare calling tools, optionally actually call the selected tool """
560            if hasattr(response.choices[0], 'delta'):
561                message = response.choices[0].delta
562            else:
563                message = response.choices[0].message
564            if self.tools and getattr(message, 'tool_calls', None):
565                # call tools
566                response_message['tool_calls'] = message.to_dict()['tool_calls']
567                tool_calls = [tool.to_dict() for tool in message.tool_calls]
568            else:
569                tool_calls = None
570            if use_tools and tool_calls:
571                results, tool_prompts = self._call_tools(tool_calls, conversation_id)
572                # ask llm to respond to tool results
573                # -- avoid recursive tool calls
574                # -- never stream results
575                kkwargs = dict(kwargs)
576                kkwargs.pop('stream', None)
577                kkwargs.pop('tools', None)
578                kkwargs.pop('tool_choice', None)
579                toolcall_messages = messages + [prompt_message] + [message] + tool_prompts
580                toolcall_messages = self.pipeline(method='toolcall',
581                                                  prompt_message=prompt_message,
582                                                  messages=toolcall_messages,
583                                                  template=template,
584                                                  conversation_id=conversation_id, **kwargs) or toolcall_messages
585                response = self.provider.complete(
586                    messages=toolcall_messages,
587                    model=self.model,
588                    **kkwargs,
589                )
590                self._track_usage(response, conversation_id)
591                tooled_response, tooled_prompt_message, tooled_response_message, raw_response = resolve_response(
592                    response,
593                    prompt_message,
594                    use_tools=False)
595                tooled_response_message['intermediate_results'] = {
596                    'tool_calls': tool_calls,
597                    'tool_prompts': tool_prompts,
598                    'tool_results': results,
599                }
600                tooled_response_message = self.pipeline(method='toolresult', response_message=tooled_response_message,
601                                                        prompt_message=prompt_message,
602                                                        messages=toolcall_messages,
603                                                        template=template,
604                                                        conversation_id=conversation_id,
605                                                        **kwargs) or tooled_response_message
606                if as_delta:
607                    # ensure the tool response is shown as a delta chunk
608                    if raw:
609                        tooled_response_message['choices'][0]['delta'] = tooled_response_message['choices'][0].pop(
610                            'message', None)
611                    else:
612                        tooled_response_message['delta'] = response_message['content']
613                return tooled_response, prompt_message, tooled_response_message
614            return response, prompt_message, response_message
615
616        def resolve_response(response, prompt_message, use_tools=False):
617            raw_response = response.to_dict()
618            if raw:
619                # native response message
620                # Ref: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/get
621                response_message = response.choices[0].message.to_dict()
622            elif getattr(response, 'error', None):
623                return response, prompt_message, {
624                    "role": "system",
625                    "content": response.error.get('message', str(response.error)),
626                    "conversation_id": conversation_id,
627                    "error": response.error,
628                }
629            else:
630                response_message = {
631                    "role": response.choices[0].message.role,
632                    "content": tryOr(lambda: response.choices[0].message.content, None),
633                    "conversation_id": conversation_id,
634                }
635            response, prompt_message, response_message = maybe_call_tools(response, prompt_message,
636                                                                          response_message, use_tools=use_tools)
637            response_message = self.pipeline(method='process', response_message=response_message,
638                                             prompt_message=prompt_message,
639                                             messages=messages,
640                                             template=template,
641                                             conversation_id=conversation_id,
642                                             **kwargs) or response_message
643            self._track_usage(response, conversation_id)
644            return response, prompt_message, response_message, raw_response
645
646        def resolve_chunk(response, chunk, chunks, prompt_message, consolidated_response, use_tools=False):
647            """ resolve a single chunk of a streamed response
648
649            Args:
650                response (OpenAIResponse): the full response object
651                chunk (OpenAIResponseChunk): the current chunk of the response
652                chunks (list): list of all chunks received so far
653                prompt_message (dict): the prompt message used for this request
654                consolidated_response (dict): the consolidated response so far
655                use_tools (bool): whether to use tools in this response
656
657            Returns:
658                tuple: (response, prompt_message, response_message, raw_response)
659
660                where:
661                    response: the full response object
662                    prompt_message: the prompt message used for this request
663                    response_message: the response message as a dictionary (choices[0].delta)
664                    raw_response: the raw response chunk as a dictionary
665
666            """
667            raw_response = chunk.to_dict()
668            if chunk.choices:
669                content = ''.join(c['choices'][0]['delta']['content'] for c in chunks) + str(
670                    chunk.choices[0].delta.content or '')
671                if raw:
672                    response_message = chunk.choices[0].delta.to_dict()
673                else:
674                    # consolidate content
675                    response_message = {
676                        "role": chunk.choices[0].delta.role,
677                        "delta": chunk.choices[0].delta.content,
678                        "content": content,
679                        "conversation_id": conversation_id,
680                        "finish_reason": chunk.choices[0].finish_reason,
681                    }
682                response, prompt_message, response_message = maybe_call_tools(chunk, prompt_message,
683                                                                              response_message, use_tools=use_tools,
684                                                                              as_delta=True)
685                response_message = self.pipeline(method='process', response_message=response_message,
686                                                 prompt_message=prompt_message,
687                                                 messages=messages,
688                                                 template=template,
689                                                 conversation_id=conversation_id,
690                                                 **kwargs) or response_message
691                # consolidate response
692                consolidated_response.update(response_message) if not consolidated_response else None
693                consolidated_response['content'] = content
694            else:
695                response_message = {}
696            chunks.append(raw_response)
697            self._track_usage(chunk, conversation_id)
698            return response, prompt_message, response_message, raw_response
699
700        if stream:
701            chunks = []
702            consolidated_response = {}
703            for chunk in response:
704                yield resolve_chunk(response, chunk, chunks, prompt_message, consolidated_response,
705                                    use_tools=use_tools)
706            consolidated_response['finish_reason'] = 'stop.consolidated'
707            yield response, prompt_message, consolidated_response, chunks[-1] if chunks else {}
708        else:
709            yield resolve_response(response, prompt_message, use_tools=use_tools)
710
711    def _parsed_completion(self, response):
712        return response.choices[0].message.content
713
714    def _prepare_template(self, template, data=None):
715        _template = (template or '').format_map(safeformat(data or {}))
716        return template
717
718    def _get_function_spec(self, func):
719        """
720        Generates an OpenAI SDK function dictionary from an annotated function.
721
722        Args:
723            func (callable): The annotated function to be converted.
724
725        Returns:
726            dict: The OpenAI SDK function dictionary.
727
728        References:
729            - https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/debugging-requests
730        """
731        if isinstance(func, dict):
732            return func
733        import inspect
734        sig = inspect.signature(func)
735        params = {}
736        TYPES = {
737            str: 'string',
738            int: 'integer',
739            float: 'float',
740            list: 'list',
741        }
742        for param in sig.parameters.values():
743            param_type = TYPES.get(
744                param.annotation) or 'string' if param.annotation != inspect.Parameter.empty else None
745            param_default = param.default if param.default != inspect.Parameter.empty else None
746            param_type = param_type or TYPES.get(type(param_default))
747            param_dict = {
748                "name": param.name,
749                "type": param_type,
750                "description": f'represents {param.name}',
751                "default": param_default,
752            }
753            params[param.name] = param_dict
754
755        return_type = str(sig.return_annotation) if sig.return_annotation != inspect.Parameter.empty else None
756
757        function_dict = {
758            "type": "function",
759            "function": {
760                "name": func.__name__,
761                "description": inspect.getdoc(func) or 'A function to return a response',
762                "parameters": {
763                    "type": "object",
764                    "properties": {
765                        k: v for k, v in params.items()
766                    },
767                },
768                "return_type": return_type,
769            }
770        }
771
772        return function_dict
773
774    def _augment_prompt(self, prompt, documents: DocumentIndex = None, query=None, template=None):
775        query = query or prompt
776        template = template or self.template
777        if not documents:
778            context = dict(prompt=prompt, query=query, documents=None, datetime=utcnow())
779            return self._resolve_template(template, **context)
780        retrieve_kwargs = self.strategy.get('retrieve', {})
781        docs = documents.retrieve(query, **retrieve_kwargs)
782        if docs:
783            documents = '\n\n'.join(d.get('text') for d in docs)
784        else:
785            documents = '(no documents found)'
786        context = dict(prompt=prompt, query=query, documents=documents, datetime=utcnow())
787        return self._resolve_template(template, **context)
788
789    def _resolve_template(self, template, **context):
790        env = SandboxedEnvironment()
791        template = env.from_string(template)
792        return template.render(**context).strip()
793
794    def _augment_message(self, message, documents: DocumentIndex = None, query=None, template=None):
795        augmented = self._augment_prompt(message.get('content', ''), documents=documents, query=query,
796                                         template=template)
797        message['content'] = augmented if augmented else message.get('content')
798        return message
799
800    def _log_events(self, event, conversation_id, data):
801        if self.tracking:
802            self.tracking.log_events(event, conversation_id, ensure_list(data))
803            self.tracking.flush()
804
805    def _track_usage(self, response, conversation_id):
806        data = ensure_dict(response)
807        if self.tracking:
808            for metric, value in data.get('usage', {}).items():
809                self.tracking.log_event('usage', metric, value, conversation_id=conversation_id)
810
811
812class Provider:
813    URL_REGEX = None
814
815    def __init__(self, api_key, base_url, model=None, **kwargs):
816        self.api_key = api_key
817        self.base_url = base_url
818        self.model = model
819
820    def embed(self, documents, dimensions=None, **kwargs):
821        raise NotImplementedError
822
823    def complete(self, model, messages, stream=False, **kwargs):
824        raise NotImplementedError
825
826    @classmethod
827    def match_url(cls, url):
828        return re.match(cls.URL_REGEX, str(url)) if cls.URL_REGEX else False
829
830
831class OpenAIProvider(Provider):
832    URL_REGEX = r'https?://(api\.openai\.com|localhost)(:\d+)?/.*'
833
834    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
835        super().__init__(*args, **kwargs)
836        self.client = OpenAI(
837            api_key=self.api_key,
838            base_url=self.base_url)
839        self.model = self.model
840
841    def embed(self, documents, dimensions=None, model=None, **kwargs):
842        documents = ensure_list(documents)
843        response = self.client.embeddings.create(
844            model=model or self.model,
845            input=documents,
846            dimensions=dimensions,
847            encoding_format="float"
848        )
849        return response
850
851    def complete(self, messages, stream=False, model=None, **kwargs):
852        if stream:
853            # https://community.openai.com/t/usage-stats-now-available-when-using-streaming-with-the-chat-completions-api-or-completions-api/738156
854            kwargs.setdefault('stream_options', {"include_usage": True})
855        response = self.client.chat.completions.create(
856            model=model or self.model,
857            messages=messages,
858            stream=stream,
859            **kwargs
860        )
861        return response
862
863
864class JinaEmbeddingsProvider(Provider):
865    URL_REGEX = r'https?://(api\.jina\.ai)(:\d+)?/.*'
866
867    def embed(self, documents, dimensions=None, model=None, **kwargs):
868        """ Embed documents using Jina AI's embedding service.
869
870        Args:
871            documents (list): List of documents to embed.
872            dimensions (int): Number of dimensions to embed to.
873            model (str): Model name to use for embedding.
874
875        Returns:
876            list: List of embeddings as list[list[float, ...]].
877        """
878        # see https://jina.ai/embeddings
879        documents = ensure_list(documents)
880        headers = {
881            'Content-Type': 'application/json',
882            'Authorization': f'Bearer {self.api_key}'
883        }
884        url = urljoin(self.base_url, 'embeddings')
885        resp = requests.post(url,
886                             headers=headers,
887                             json={'model': self.model,
888                                   'input': [{
889                                       'text': doc
890                                   } for doc in documents]})
891        assert resp.status_code == 200, f'Error {resp.status_code} calling {url}: {resp.text}'
892        response = resp.json()
893        return response
894
895
896class AnythingLLMProvider(Provider):
897    URL_REGEX = r'https?://(api\.anythingllm\.com|localhost:(3001)+|anythingllm\.com)/.*'
898
899    def embed(self, documents, dimensions=None, **kwargs):
900        """ Embed documents
901
902        Args:
903            documents (list): list of documents to embed
904            dimensions (int): number of dimensions to embed to
905
906        Returns:
907            list: list of embeddings as list[list[float, ...]]
908        """
909        headers = {
910            'Content-Type': 'application/json',
911            'Authorization': f'Bearer {self.api_key}',
912        }
913        url = urljoin(self.base_url, 'embeddings')
914        documents = ensure_list(documents)
915        resp = requests.post(url,
916                             headers=headers,
917                             json={'inputs': documents,
918                                   'model': self.model})
919        assert resp.status_code == 200, f'Error {resp.status_code} calling {url}: {resp.text}'
920        response = resp.json()
921        return response
922
923    def complete(self, messages, stream=False, **kwargs):
924        headers = {
925            'Content-Type': 'application/json',
926            'Authorization': f'Bearer {self.api_key}',
927        }
928        url = f'{self.base_url}/chat/completions'
929        resp = requests.post(url,
930                             headers=headers,
931                             json={'messages': messages,
932                                   'model': self.model,
933                                   'stream': stream})
934        return resp.json()
935
936
937class OllamaProvider(Provider):
938    URL_REGEX = r'https?://(api\.ollama\.com|localhost)(:\d+)?/.*'
939
940    def embed(self, documents, dimensions=None, **kwargs):
941        """ Embed documents using Ollama's embedding service.
942
943        Args:
944            documents (list): List of documents to embed.
945            dimensions (int): Number of dimensions to embed to.
946
947        Returns:
948            list: List of embeddings as list[list[float, ...]].
949        """
950        # see https://ollama.com/docs/api/embeddings
951        documents = ensure_list(documents)
952        headers = {
953            'Content-Type': 'application/json',
954            'Authorization': f'Bearer {self.api_key}'
955        }
956        url = urljoin(self.base_url, 'embeddings')
957        resp = requests.post(url,
958                             headers=headers,
959                             json={'model': self.model,
960                                   'input': documents})
961        assert resp.status_code == 200, f'Error {resp.status_code} calling {url}: {resp.text}'
962        response = resp.json()
963        return response
964
965
966PROVIDERS = {
967    'openai': OpenAIProvider,
968    'anythingllm': AnythingLLMProvider,
969    'jina': JinaEmbeddingsProvider,
970    'default': OpenAIProvider,
971}
972
973
974class safeformat(dict):
975    def __missing__(self, key):
976        return f"{{{key}}}"  # return "{<key>}"
